required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: God Nat - God Dag. A Randomized Controlled Trial of Bedtime Music as Early Intervention for Sleep-onset Insomnia

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a randomized controlled trial evaluating the effect of bedtime music as an early intervention for sleep-onset insomnia in adults. The investigators use a randomized controlled trial design with two parallel groups. All participants receive sleep hygiene advice as standard treatment and participants in the intervention group are additionally asked to listen to a sleep playlist daily at bedtime. Subjective and objective sleep measures are evaluated before and after the 4 weeks intervention period. In addition, follow-up measures of subjective outcomes are assessed 4 weeks after the end of the intervention period.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
primary_outcome.description: Measured with the Insomnia Severity Index, range 0-28 with higher scores indicating more severe insomnia.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, range 0-21 with higher scores indicating more sleep problems.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
secondary_outcome.description: Difficulties initiating sleep as measured with Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index subscale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
secondary_outcome.description: Objective sleep quality as measured with polysomnography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep-wake pattern as measured with wrist-actigraphy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life as measured with SF-36, range 0-100 with higher scores indicating better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-sleep arousal as measured with the Pre-Sleep Arousal Scale, range 8-40 with higher scores indicating higher pre-sleep arousal.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
other_outcome.description: Depressive symptoms as measured with Beck Depression Inventory II, range 0-63 with higher scores indicating more severe depression.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to after the 4-week intervention period.
other_outcome.description: Anxiety as measured with the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, range 0-80 with higher scores indicating more anxiety.

arm_group.description: Treatment as usual including sleep hygiene advice
Treatment as usual (sleep hygiene advice) and bedtime music listening

intervention.description: Participants receive standard sleep hygiene advice.
Participants in the intervention group listen to their preferred sleep playlist daily at bedtime for minimum 30 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sleep-onset insomnia for 3-18 months
Exclusion Criteria:
1. use of medications (benzodiazepines, z-drugs, antidepressive and anti-psychotic drugs)
2. alcohol or substance abuse
3. pregnant or breastfeeding women
4. other sleep disorders (e.g. sleep apnea, restless leg syndrome, etc.)
5. current psychiatric disorder or a history of psychotic disorders
6. somatic disorders interfering with sleep (e.g. critical illness, pain disorders, neuro-degenerative disorders)
7. shift work.
